headline: Justices Give Green Light to Trump Plan to Deny Green Cards to Needy Immigrants
abstract: The new policy revised the so-called public charge rule, making immigrants ineligible for permanent legal status if they use public benefits like Medicaid and food stamps.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON â€” The Supreme Court on Monday allowed the Trump administration to move forward with plans to deny green cards to immigrants who are thought to be likely to make even occasional and minor use of public benefits like Medicaid, food stamps and housing vouchers.
